publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1204 Mr David Davidson: Newton Dee Village Community-That the Parliament recognises the huge investment in, and the excellent and unique work accomplished at, the Newton Dee Village Community since 1940 and also at the 11 other centres of the Camphill Village Trust through the provision of fulfilling work opportunities and homes for adults with learning disabilities; commends the pioneering health care provision available to residents and the local community; recognises the impact this has on the development of wide-ranging interests and participation in cultural and social activities, and believes that everything possible should be done to allow the community to continue undisturbed and to develop over future years.

*S2M-1204*#* Mr David Davidson: Newton Dee Village Community-That the Parliament recognises the huge investment in, and the excellent and unique work accomplished at, the Newton Dee Village Community since 1940 and also at the 11 other centres of the Camphill Village Trust through the provision of fulfilling work opportunities and homes for adults with learning disabilities; commends the pioneering health care provision available to residents and the local community; recognises the impact this has on the development of wide-ranging interests and participation in cultural and social activities, and believes that everything possible should be done to allow the community to continue undisturbed and to develop over future years. Supported by: John Swinburne*
S2M-1204# Newton Dee Village Community (lodged on 26 April 2004) Murdo Fraser*

S2M-1204# Mr David Davidson: Newton Dee Village Community-That the Parliament recognises the huge investment in, and the excellent and unique work accomplished at, the Newton Dee Village Community since 1940 and also at the 11 other centres of the Camphill Village Trust through the provision of fulfilling work opportunities and homes for adults with learning disabilities; commends the pioneering health care provision available to residents and the local community; recognises the impact this has on the development of wide-ranging interests and participation in cultural and social activities, and believes that everything possible should be done to allow the community to continue undisturbed and to develop over future years. Supported by: John Swinburne, Murdo Fraser, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-1204# Newton Dee Village Community (lodged on 26 April 2004) Phil Gallie*
S2M-1204# Newton Dee Village Community (lodged on 26 April 2004) Alex Johnstone*

S2M-1204# Newton Dee Village Community (lodged on 26 April 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Eleanor Scott*, Mark Ballard*, John Scott*, Robin Harper*, Shiona Baird*, Bill Aitken*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S2M-1204# Newton Dee Village Community (lodged on 26 April 2004) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-1204# Newton Dee Village Community (lodged on 26 April 2004) Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-1204# Mr David Davidson: Newton Dee Village Community-That the Parliament recognises the huge investment in, and the excellent and unique work accomplished at, the Newton Dee Village Community since 1940 and also at the 11 other centres of the Camphill Village Trust through the provision of fulfilling work opportunities and homes for adults with learning disabilities; commends the pioneering health care provision available to residents and the local community; recognises the impact this has on the development of wide-ranging interests and participation in cultural and social activities, and believes that everything possible should be done to allow the community to continue undisturbed and to develop over future years. Supported by: John Swinburne, Murdo Fraser, Mrs Nanette Milne, Phil Gallie, Alex Johnstone, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Eleanor Scott, Mark Ballard, John Scott, Robin Harper, Shiona Baird, Bill Aitken, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Ms Sandra White, Mr Mark Ruskell, Dr Jean Turner
